reviews.review_msg: (SA375) Probably the best prof I've ever had. Incredibly caring, focused on student wellbeing, knowledgeable, and funny. Participation is essential; no PowerPoints, always helpful and interesting discussions. Had to print readings for open-book exam, but she's willing to help out if cost is a problem. Absolutely would take this prof again.

The feedback that Kathleen offers on writing assignments is incredibly helpful and challenges her students to become better writers. Lectures are very interesting and the seminar discussions are incredibly engaging. If you are truly interested in SOCANTH do not miss an opportunity to take a class with one of the best professors in the department!
Great prof, knowledgable and enthusiastic. Seminars cut between lecture and group discussion. Assignments tailored to student strengths. Really cares about their students.

Ann was a very intelligent prof however a very difficult marker. Be prepared to do all of the readings and understand each concept that is brought up. There are no participation or attendance marks. Marks were given into three areas (two exams and one project) which left little room for error. This class was special topics of children and society

Had to take this 4 credit course as an elective to finish my degree. Honestly the WORST prof ever in SFU. Assign super low marks, grab on to every little detail to cut off your mark. Lecture is dry like dessert, its impossible to stay awake. Not allowed to come late, skip 3 class you fail the entire course. Critize your work in front of the class.

incredibly interesting. Although his lectures can be slow paced, the lecture and course materials and incredibly informative and easy to link, but there are a lot of readings that require close analysis/time. He does discussion papers every week for a little bit of your mark, if you do them you will have a good understanding of course materials

Dreaded going to class after being attacked for my personal opinions on a simple subject that did not even have to do with the course.  I found her fake with us, however extremely knowledgeable.  But then again, who wouldn't be knowledgeable if they used their own book as a bible for the class.

Great course! I totally enjoy her class, seriously. U can disagree with her as long as u present a valid argument. Yea, the summaries are a lil demanding for only 10%, but hey,it's a very smart way of getting students to do e readings.If u wanna learn more about political sociology,go for it! She genuinely cares 4 students, and a fair marker too!

Bias and defensive -- Your answer to the general class would be taken as direct attack on hers. Can't read her writing on overhead projector. Not recommended unless you are going to show that you are agreeing to her point of view. Will not take her class ever.

Islam and Global Politics. Spring 2006. 4  readings per evening/class. 3 sumaries (10% each) based on 3 of the 4 readings counted for the total mark of 100%. Yet, summaries must refer to previous week's 4 readings/authors' main points. Not way out, if you are not on top of all the readings.

Professor Mitchell is one of the best profs I've had in my time at university. She is very caring and supportive, recognizes when it is a stressful time of the semester, and gives substantial feedback (which is rare while courses are online). Her layout of the course was also very manageable. I took SA 231 with her in the past, highly recommend.
